title: In-app marketplace removal
body:
<!--
Hello 👋 Thank you for submitting a pull request.

To help us merge your PR, make sure to follow the instructions below:

- Create or update the tests
- Create or update the documentation at https://github.com/strapi/documentation
- Refer to the issue you are closing in the PR description: Fix #issue
- Specify if the PR is ready to be merged or work in progress (by opening a draft PR)

Please ensure you read the Contributing Guide: https://github.com/strapi/strapi/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

### What does it do?

It removes the in app marketplace. In particular:

1. It removes the page located at `/admin/marketplace`
2. It allows menu links to specify a 'target' prop
3. It updates the main menu link to `https://market.strapi.io` opening a new tab
4. It updates the 'Custom Field' link to go to `https://market.strapi.io?categories=Custom+fields`
5. It leaves the marketplace permissions in tact, allowing RBAC for the marketplace menu item
6. It removes all the associated marketplace translations 

### Why is it needed?

Because the in-app marketplace is not adding enough value. We rather put time in to improving the standalone marketplace hosted at https://market.strapi.io

### How to test it?

Start the Strapi app and witness the changes as described.

title: fix: add pagination support for /api/upload/files endpoint (#24624)
body:
### What does it do?

This PR fixes an issue where **pagination was not properly applied in the Upload plugin’s file list**.  
The backend was ignoring pagination params (`page`, `pageSize`, `start`, `limit`) for `/upload/files`, causing incorrect results when navigating pages.

The fix ensures:
- Pagination params are correctly validated
- Correct query parameters are passed to the entity service
- File list responses now match expected pagination behavior

### Why is it needed?

Without this fix:
- The Upload library UI shows incorrect page results
- API consumers receive full lists instead of paginated results
- Large media libraries cause slow responses or timeouts

This update restores correct pagination functionality and improves performance in large projects.

### How to test it?

1. Go to **Media Library → List View**
2. Ensure you have more than 20 files
3. Navigate through pages  
   You should now see:
   - Correct number of items on each page  
   - Accurate total/page metadata  
   - No duplication/missing items  
4. API test:  
   Call  
```

GET /api/upload/files?page=2&pageSize=10

```
You should receive the correct paginated result.

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

Fixes: **#24624**  
(Upload plugin pagination not working)

Copied description:

**## What does it do?
Fixes the `/auth/refresh` endpoint to correctly read refresh tokens from httpOnly cookies when configured, instead of always requiring them in the request body.

## Why is it needed?
When the users-permissions plugin is configured with `httpOnly: true` for enhanced security, the `/auth/refresh` endpoint was incorrectly returning HTTP 400 "Missing refresh token" despite the refresh token cookie being present in the request.

## Related issue(s)/PR(s)
Closes #24669

## How to test it?
1. Configure users-permissions plugin with:
   ```javascript
   'users-permissions': {
     config: {
       jwtManagement: 'refresh',
       sessions: {
         httpOnly: true,
         cookie: {
           name: 'strapi_up_refresh',
           sameSite: 'lax',
           path: '/',
         },
       },
     },
   }**
   
Provide information about the environment and the path to verify the behaviour.

title: fix(content-type-builder): ai chat message width and submit behavior
body: ## Fix message width when long content (with no breakable characters) ### What does it do? Adds `overflow-wrap: anywhere` and `word-break: break-word` CSS properties to both assistant messages and user messages to ensure long strings wrap within the chat message containers instead of overflowing. ### Why is it needed? Very long strings (e.g., URLs, concatenated text without spaces) were overflowing the message bubble containers, breaking the chat UI layout and making content unreadable. ### How to test it? 1. Open the Content-Type Builder AI chat 2. Send a message containing a very long string without spaces (e.g., "ItwouldbegreatifIcouldgrouparticlesintoseriesorcollectionslikeamulti") 3. Or trigger an AI response that contains such a long string 4. Verify that the text wraps within the message bubble boundaries instead of overflowing horizontally ## Fix submit message button ### What does it do? Adds `type="submit"` attribute to the send message `IconButton` in the Content-Type Builder AI chat input component. This enables the button to properly trigger form submission when clicked, allowing users to submit messages via the button in addition to the Enter key. ### Why is it needed? Previously, clicking the submit button in the AI chat did nothing - only pressing Enter would submit messages. This was because the `IconButton` component inside the form lacked the `type="submit"` attribute, so it didn't trigger the form's `onSubmit` handler. The Enter key worked because it was handled manually via a `onKeyDown` event in the `ResizableTextArea` component. ### How to test it? 1. Navigate to the Content-Type Builder in the Strapi admin panel 2. Open the AI chat (click the sparkle icon in the bottom-right corner) 3. Type a message in the chat input 4. Click the submit button (arrow up icon) - the message should be sent 5. Verify that pressing Enter still works as before 6. Verify that the button is disabled when the input is empty and there are no attachments ## Related issue(s)/PR(s) —

title: fix: issue where Negative number attributes were not correctly compar…
body:
Issue where Negative number attributes were not correctly compared with "minimum" requirement

Fix #24861 

What does it do?
I updated the `maybeWithMinMax` utility function in `packages/core/utils/src/validation/utilities.ts` to apply min and max constraints independently. Previously, it only applied them if both were defined. I also added a unit test file `packages/core/utils/src/tests/validation-utilities.test.ts` to verify this behavior.

Why is it needed?
This fixes a bug where decimal number attributes (and others using this utility) were not being validated against their minimum requirement if a maximum wasn't also set (and vice versa). Specifically, negative numbers were being accepted even when they were below the configured minimum.

How to test it?
You can run the newly added unit test to verify the fix:

Navigate to packages/core/utils
Run yarn test:unit src/__tests__/validation-utilities.test.ts
The test confirms that both. `min` and `max` constraints are correctly applied even when used individually.

title: chore: replace deprecated Buffer.slice() with subarray() in encryption utils
body:
### What does it do?

Replaces the deprecated `Buffer.slice()` method with `Buffer.subarray()` in the data-transfer encryption utilities. The changes affect both encryption and decryption cipher creation functions in:
- encrypt.ts
- decrypt.ts

### Why is it needed?

The `Buffer.slice()` method has been deprecated in Node.js in favor of `Buffer.subarray()`. While both methods currently work the same way, using the deprecated method:
- Triggers deprecation warnings in newer Node.js versions
- Goes against Node.js best practices and recommendations
- May be removed in future Node.js releases

Migrating to `subarray()` ensures the codebase remains compatible with current and future Node.js versions and eliminates deprecation warnings.

### How to test it?

- Run the existing unit tests for the data-transfer package:
   ```bash
   cd packages/core/data-transfer
   yarn test
   ```
- Test encryption/decryption functionality by running an import and export, attempt to import an exported file from a previous version

Hello 👋 Thank you for submitting a pull request.

To help us merge your PR, make sure to follow the instructions below:

Please ensure you read the Contributing Guide: https://github.com/strapi/strapi/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

### What does it do?

Implemented a session identifier system for Content Type Builder (CTB) tracking events in Strapi. 

### Why is it needed?

All CTB-related tracking events now include a unique session ID that groups events within the same CTB session.

### How to test it?

With a lot of patience:
- run the tracker locally
- change the env variable STRAPI_ANALYTICS_URL to point the local tracker (http://localhost:4000)
- temporarily edit the tracker to log the events
- navigate through the CTB (AI CTB included)

all the events should have an event property `ctbSessionId` generated/updated when CTB is accessed (on mount), the server restarts after saving schema, or the user navigates away and returns to CTB

Also new `willUpdateCTBSchema` event has been implemented that fires when the save button is clicked (before save operation) and that includes all tracking properties + ctbSessionId

title: fix: discard draft creates published comp relations correctly
body:
### What does it do?

Essentially, when a published component had a relation to a published entry,  after migration it had a relation to both the published and draft version of that entry, and then the published link was removed by a db repair script, leaving the incorrect relation. This ensures that only the correct relation is created.

### Why is it needed?

Fixes the issue described in https://github.com/strapi/strapi/pull/24798#issuecomment-3556822284

### How to test it?

Create a v4 project with a draft and publish content type with a published item with a component that has a relation to another published item. Migrate to v5 and start up the project, and the relations should all still exist in the database.

See `chore/example-projects-migrations` for tools to make testing this easier, including a seed and validation script that includes a check for this case.

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)


Alternative to https://github.com/strapi/strapi/pull/24893 which reverts the migration to the previous version rather than fixing it

title: fix(cli): transfer command ignores CLI flags and prompts unnecessarily
body:
### What does it do?

This PR fixes two critical bugs in the `strapi transfer` CLI command that were introduced in PR #23421:

**Bug #1: Interactive prompts always run (Issue #23688)**  
The interactive prompt hook was not properly gated with a conditional check, causing it to execute even when `--from`, `--from-token`, and `--force` flags were provided via the command line.

*Technical Changes:*
- Wrapped the interactive prompts hook (lines 54-190 in `command.ts`) with `ifOptions()` to only execute when neither `--from` nor `--to` is provided
- This prevents the prompts from running when users provide all required options via CLI flags
- Made all `ifOptions` condition callbacks async to match TypeScript signature requirements

**Bug #2: Wrong return type in determineDirection()**  
The `determineDirection()` function was returning the URL object instead of the string `'from'` or `'to'`, causing downstream code to fail when trying to use the direction as an object key.

*Technical Change:*
- Changed `return opts.from` to `return 'from'` (line 105)
- Changed `return opts.to` to `return 'to'` (line 108)
- This ensures the direction is used correctly as a string key for accessing `opts[direction]` and `opts[${direction}Token]`

### Why is it needed?

Users running the transfer command in non-interactive environments (CI/CD pipelines, automated scripts) were unable to use the command because it would always prompt for input, even when all required flags were provided:

```bash
yarn strapi transfer \
  --from https://origin.com/admin \
  --from-token abc123 \
  --force \
  --exclude files
# ❌ Still prompted for URL and token
```

This broke:
- **CI/CD pipelines**: Automated deployments would hang waiting for input
- **Scripts**: Shell scripts using the transfer command would fail  
- **--force flag**: The force flag was completely ignored
- **Non-interactive usage**: Any automated or scripted usage was impossible

### How to test it?

**Test Scenario 1: Non-interactive usage with all flags (reproduces #23688)**
```bash
# Should proceed WITHOUT prompts
yarn strapi transfer \
  --from https://source.strapi.io/admin \
  --from-token YOUR_TOKEN \
  --force \
  --exclude files

# Expected: Transfer proceeds directly
# Before fix: Would prompt for URL and token
```

**Test Scenario 2: Non-interactive push with all flags**
```bash
# Should proceed WITHOUT prompts
yarn strapi transfer \
  --to https://destination.strapi.io/admin \
  --to-token YOUR_TOKEN \
  --force

# Expected: Transfer proceeds directly
# Before fix: Would prompt for URL and token
```

**Test Scenario 3: Interactive usage without flags (should still work)**
```bash
# Should show interactive prompts
yarn strapi transfer

# Expected: Prompts for direction, URL, and token
# Should still work after fix
```

**Test Scenario 4: Partial flags (should prompt for missing)**
```bash
# Should prompt only for token
yarn strapi transfer --from https://source.strapi.io/admin

# Expected: Prompts only for missing token
# Should work after fix
```

**Unit Tests:**
```bash
yarn test:unit packages/core/strapi/src/cli/commands/transfer/__tests__/transfer.test.ts
```

New tests added:
- `--from` with auth not provided (should error)
- `--from` with source URL and token (should succeed)
- `--from` uses local Strapi destination when `--to` not specified

**Build and Type Checking:**
```bash
yarn build --projects=@strapi/strapi
yarn build:types --projects=@strapi/strapi
```

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

Fixes #23688  
Caused by #23421  
Additional bug identified by @WDeenik in https://github.com/strapi/strapi/pull/23421#discussion_r2207601028

title: feat(users-permissions): add refresh and logout actions to default permissions
body:
### What does it do?

  Adds missing default permissions for the `auth.refresh` and `auth.logout` endpoints to the `DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS` array in the users-permissions plugin:
  - `auth.refresh` → `public` role (allows unauthenticated token refresh)
  - `auth.logout` → `authenticated` role (requires valid access token)

  ### Why is it needed?

 403 Forbidden when calling `/api/auth/refresh`, as it was never added to `DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS`. Even with a valid refresh token, because the public role had no permission to access the endpoint.


  ### How to test it?

  **Prerequisites:**
  - Configure users and permissions with `jwtManagement: 'refresh'`

  **Test refresh endpoint (public access):**
  ```bash
  # Login to get refresh token
  curl -X POST http://localhost:1337/api/auth/local \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    -d '{"identifier":"user@example.com","password":"password"}'

  # Refresh WITHOUT Authorization header (should return 200, not 403)
  curl -X POST http://localhost:1337/api/auth/refresh \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    -d '{"refreshToken":"<token-from-login>"}'

  Expected: Returns HTTP 200 with new JWT and refreshToken

  Test logout endpoint (authenticated access):
  # Should require Authorization header
  curl -X POST http://localhost:1337/api/auth/logout \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer <jwt-token>"

  Expected: Returns HTTP 200 and invalidates session
```

 ### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

  Fixes #24867
  Fixes #24871

title: Fix refresh token permissions
body:
### What does it do?

Adds the `auth.refresh` endpoint to the `DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS` array in the users-permissions service, marking it as a public route that doesn't require Bearer token authentication.

**Technical changes:**
- Modified `packages/plugins/users-permissions/server/services/users-permissions.js`
- Added `{ action: 'plugin::users-permissions.auth.refresh', roleType: 'public' }` to the `DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS` array
- This allows the `/api/auth/refresh` endpoint to be accessed without an `Authorization` header, relying solely on the refresh token validation

### Why is it needed?

The `/api/auth/refresh` endpoint was incorrectly requiring an `Authorization: Bearer <access_token>` header, returning **403 Forbidden** when called without it. This defeats the purpose of the refresh token mechanism.

**Current behavior (bug):**
- ✅ Works when valid access token is provided in Authorization header
- ❌ Returns 403 when no Authorization header is provided (even with valid refresh token)
- ✅ Returns 401 when invalid access token is provided

**Expected behavior:**
- The refresh endpoint should accept only a valid refresh token (in request body or cookie)
- It should NOT require a valid access token in the Authorization header
- This is the standard OAuth2 refresh token flow

**Root cause:**
The `auth.refresh` action was missing from the `DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS` array, causing it to be treated as a protected route requiring authentication and permission checks before the controller logic could validate the refresh token.

### How to test it?

**Environment:**
- Node.js 22.21.1
- npm 9.2.0
- Strapi 5.31.0
- Windows 10
- SQLite database
- TypeScript

**Configuration:**
```typescript
// config/plugins.ts
export default ({ env }) => ({
  'users-permissions': {
    config: {
      jwtManagement: 'refresh',
      sessions: {
        accessTokenLifespan: 30,
        maxRefreshTokenLifespan: 2592000,
        idleRefreshTokenLifespan: 604800,
        httpOnly: true,
        cookie: {
          name: 'strapi_up_refresh',
          sameSite: 'lax',
          path: '/',
          secure: env('NODE_ENV') === 'production',
        },
      },
    },
  },
});

title: fix(content-manager): preserve fields with visible:false during form submission
body:
### What does it do?

This PR fixes the `handleInvisibleAttributes` function to properly distinguish between:
1. **Static hidden fields** (`visible: false`) 
2. **Conditionally hidden fields** (`conditions.visible`)

**Technical changes:**
- Added early return for fields with `visible: false` to pass them through unchanged
- These fields are preserved from either `data` or `initialValues` without processing
- The function continues to properly handle `conditions.visible` (JSON Logic rules)
- Added comprehensive tests covering both scenarios

### Why is it needed?

**Problem:** 
Fields with `visible: false` were being incorrectly set to `null` when not present in form data,

**Use case:**
Plugins (like strapi-plugin-sitemap) add hidden fields that are permanently invisible
```javascript
_.set(attributes, 'sitemap_exclude', {
  visible: false,  // Permanently hidden
  type: 'boolean',
});
```
### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

fixes issue mentioned in this PR #24628

title: fix(upload): file-type does not support commonjs
body:
### What does it do?

Replace static import with dynamic import for file-type package to support ESM-only modules in both CommonJS/ESM builds.

The maintainer mentions this approach here: https://gist.github.com/sindresorhus/a39789f98801d908bbc7ff3ecc99d99c

### Why is it needed?

file-type is ESM-only and lacks CommonJS exports. When Strapi builds its CommonJS output, the bundler fails to transform the static import to require(). This breaks app startup on Node.js < 22, which has stricter ESM/CommonJS interop. Dynamic imports work at runtime in both module formats.

### How to test it?

You will need to be able to switch node versions with something like https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm

Switch to node 20 (`nvm install 20` if it's not already installed. `nvm use 20` to use it, `node -v` to confirm)
Create a strapi app with `npx create-strapi-app@0.0.0-experimental.f9ca9ac9518346cac58a4a3a576bc9d9d795570d test-fix --quickstart`
Update the config in `config/plugins.js`:

```
upload: {
    config: {
      security: {
        deniedTypes: ['video/*'],
      }
    }
  }
```
Run `npm run develop` there should NOT be an error
Go to the media library and try to upload a video, it should be rejected
Try to upload other file types not in the deniedTypes list, it should work


Test the same for all node versions up to 24

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

Resolves https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues/24829

title: feat(core): adding clear button to boolean toggle
body:
<!--
Hello 👋 Thank you for submitting a pull request.

To help us merge your PR, make sure to follow the instructions below:

- Create or update the tests
- Create or update the documentation at https://github.com/strapi/documentation
- Refer to the issue you are closing in the PR description: Fix #issue
- Specify if the PR is ready to be merged or work in progress (by opening a draft PR)

Please ensure you read the Contributing Guide: https://github.com/strapi/strapi/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

### What does it do?

This pull request restores the ability to clear Boolean fields by re-introducing a “Clear” option for nullable Boolean attributes. It ensures that users can unset a previously selected true or false value and revert the field back to null.

### Why is it needed?

In version 4, Boolean fields were nullable and included a “Clear” button allowing users to reset the value to null.
In version 5, this option is missing, making it impossible to unset a Boolean once it has been set.

### How to test it?

1. Create or open an entity that includes a Boolean field.
2. Create an entry and set the Boolean field to either true or false.
3. Save the entry.
4. Reopen the entry and verify that a “Clear” button is available above or beside the Boolean field.
5. Click “Clear” and confirm:
    - The value resets to null.
    - The admin UI displays the field as unset.
    - Saving the entry persists the null value.

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues/22733

### What does it do?

- Remove the duplicate getAiToken function found in admin (already in admin/ee)
- Move getAiToken business logic to the ai container so it can be used by other features
- Remove the `useAIAvailability` hook from admin and replace all imports with the `useAIAvailability` hook exported from ee

### Why is it needed?

- It's just confusing
- It isn't clear where to add shared ai related apis
- Some features are using ee apis while others using admin apis

### How to test it?

**With growth license**

Test AI CTB, AI Media Lib, AI i18n
The features should all work as expected. If the AI responds correctly then all should be good. 

**With EE license and no license**
There should be no AI features and everything should work as normal

title: fix(graphql): scope status filter inheritance to query tree
body:
### What does it do?

This PR fixes an issue where custom GraphQL resolvers were incorrectly inheriting status filters from built-in queries, causing relation fields to return null when draft/publish filtering was applied.

### Why is it needed?

The rootQueryArgs introduced in PR #23737 to fix duplicate relations in draft/publish queries was request-scoped instead of query-scoped. This caused unintended cross-contamination between different root queries in the same GraphQL request.

### How to test it?

follow the example in this issue #23936
relations should not return null anymore

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

fixes #23936

title: fix: bulk unpublish when creating a new locale
body:
### What does it do?

When we create a new locale for an entry and trigger the bulk unpublish action, an error is thrown to the user instead of opening the modal.

Before 💔

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8958f4e5-3123-4cb5-beee-51e76b349a57


After ✨

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/27dcbc47-6bb0-4c75-b21c-de7c90bf6027


### Why is it needed?

The error shouldn't happen and even if we're on a new locale, the user should be able to bulk unpublish other versions of a document.

### How to test it?

_You need a collection type with Draft & Publish + Internationalization enabled_
- Go to the Content Manager
- Create a new entry
- Enter anything and Publish
- In the locale selector (top right), select another locale to create a new draft
- Click on the three dots next to the Publish action and select Unpublish multiple locales
-> The modal should appear with the published version of the document (previous locale published)

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

Resolves #22631

🚀

This is a major release.

Breaking

  • .body=<json> should not overwrite type if type already json koajs/koa#1120
  • Remove special ENOENT support koajs/koa#1861 - this is a big change and will require any file servers to adapt to this change for handling 404s / files not found
  • Removes generator deprecation messages. Generators are no longer supported. Koa no longer asserts if generators are used. Set content-length: 0 if body is explicitly set to null @​ognjenjevremovic #1528 Remove obsolete createAsyncCtxStorageMiddleware koajs/koa#1817

title: fix: show relations per locale in listview
body: ### What does it do? Fetch the relations per locale if localization is enabled for that content type. (+ re-add and fix the related tests and add new tests related to this) ### Why is it needed? The Relations dropdown showed the default locale's relations despite the list view currently being filtered by another locale, thus showing the entry in that locale (and not the default one) **BEFORE** _List view with English entry's relation in dropdown despite being in French's list view_ _English Entry_ _French Entry_ **AFTER** ### How to test it? * In the Settings, enable Internationalization and add an additional locale. * In the CTB, create two Content Types (for example Book and Author) and connect them with a one-to-many relationship (_Author has Many Books_). * Create entries to both Content Types in the default locale and additional locale. * Switch between the available locales in the list view of _Author_, then return to the default locale (English in this case). * See that the Relations in the Books column are correct per locale. ### Related issue(s)/PR(s) https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues/23468

### What does it do?

Fixes an error in View mode that occurs when removing an existing placeholder or descriptions from a field.

### Why is it needed?

To allow users to clear placeholders and descriptions without triggering errors and ensure expected saving behavior.

### How to test it?

1. Create a content type with a text field.
2. In View mode, set and save a placeholder or description.
3. Reopen View mode, remove the placeholder or description, and save.
    - No error should appear, and the placeholder should be cleared successfully.

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues/22966

title: fix(db): replace discardDrafts calls in v5 migration with queries
body:
### What does it do?

Drop-in replacement of the discard drafts migration for Strapi v4 -> v5 -- that is, if you already completed that one, this one will not need to run again.

### Why is it needed?

https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues?q=sort%3Aupdated-desc%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20discard%20drafts

Performance was so bad before that it was a blocker for projects with extemely large datasets (millions of records) that would often run for 20+ hours or run out of memory from the transaction

There were also issues with connection pools growing too large that should not be present anymore.

This should also fix issues with missing self relations in components (#24544) 

### How to test it?

1. Start with a Strapi v4 project
2. Fill it with complex data types and relations, in particular:
- draft and publish related to non-d&p and vice versa
- self references
- components (including with items with self references)
3. At this point, be sure to back up your database and code so you can test again later!
4. Upgrade to this branch (experimental coming soon)
5. Start up Strapi v5 and check that all of your data was migrated successfully and is visible in the admin with the correct publication status, and the relations all with the correct publication status

See the branch `chore/example-projects-migrations` for tools to do that more easily

Experimental: `0.0.0-experimental.a1edcc9d9fab426bad8fd1a111e6d06cb07849be`

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

Replaces https://github.com/strapi/strapi/pull/24545

Almost everything here:
https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues?q=sort%3Aupdated-desc%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20discard%20drafts

fixes #24488
fixes #23812 
fixes #22963 
fixes #23401
fixes https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues/24544

What it will not solve:

- it may not solve out of memory issues caused by the transaction. for that, we will probably need to add a new (experimental/somewhat dangerous) flag to run migrations without a transaction

title: fix(core): max length on short text
body: ### What does it do? Limits the Maximum length for Short text fields to 255 and shows a validation error if a higher value is entered. ### Why is it needed? Short text maps to `VARCHAR(255)` in the database. Allowing larger values is misleading and can cause inconsistencies. ### How to test it? 1. Go to Content Type Builder 2. Create (or edit) a text field 3. Choose Short text as the type 4. Enter a value greater than 255 in the Maximum length field 5. A validation error message should be displayed ### Related issue(s)/PR(s) https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues/24642

title: chore(tests): add setupDatabaseReset utility
body:
### What does it do?

Add `setupDatabaseReset` utility. Accomplishes the same goal as `testInTransaction` by resetting the database after each test has run. It's slower but more reliable and is not vulnerable to test failures caused by function calls outside the test's transaction context when using testInTransaction. 

Updates the docker file to spin up test databases since it was throwing an error when starting

### Why is it needed?

testInTransaction often causes API tests to fail since some async code is intentionally fired without await and then tries to execute after the test's transaction context has closed

For example see: https://github.com/strapi/strapi/actions/runs/19104795038/job/54586327649?pr=24648

### How to test it?

The API tests should pass on this PR

Test it locally by running the docker test file `docker-compose -f docker-compose.test.yml up`

Now you can test all database dialects with `yarn test:api --db=<sqlite | postgres | mysql>`

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)

I've tested (in the CI) this will resolves the transaction error causing tests to fail on:

https://github.com/strapi/strapi/pull/24648

title: fix: get draft relations count from document with locale
body:
<!--
Hello 👋 Thank you for submitting a pull request.

To help us merge your PR, make sure to follow the instructions below:

- Create or update the tests
- Create or update the documentation at https://github.com/strapi/documentation
- Refer to the issue you are closing in the PR description: Fix #issue
- Specify if the PR is ready to be merged or work in progress (by opening a draft PR)

Please ensure you read the Contributing Guide: https://github.com/strapi/strapi/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

### What does it do?
Get `countDraftRelations` from current locale, not just for the document.

### Why is it needed?
If a single type had entries in locale(s) other than the default locale, there was an alert to display the error in fetching the `countDraftRelations` for that document. The goal here is to remove that alert by fetching the relations from the locale, not just the document, so that the correct count is returned for that locale's entry.

⚠️ _Seems like the `countDraftRelations` returns all relations (published are counted as draft relations too) instead of just draft relations for now: https://www.notion.so/strapi/Count-draft-relations-56901b492efb45ab90d42fe975b32bd8 but I'm not touching this here_

**BEFORE**
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2587e26f-65c6-4650-8201-a6f63771bafb

**AFTER**
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e438739-c9dd-47ab-a732-6dcbe46cddd4

### How to test it?
* Go to the Settings for the Internationalization and add an additional locale 
* Go to the CTB and create a Single type with at least one field + localization enabled
* Go to the CM and create an entry in an additional locale
* Navigate between the "Create an entry" (in the default locale) and your existing entry, without creating an entry in the default locale => There should be no Alert.

### Related issue(s)/PR(s)
https://github.com/strapi/strapi/issues/23450
